text: is there a way to programmatically determine if a certain page has been dev'ed in the current project? I.e. given `Foo.jl` which is installed in the current project, I want to test whether it was dev'ed or added.

elements.text: is there a way to programmatically determine if a certain page has been dev'ed in the current project? I.e. given
which is installed in the current project, I want to test whether it was dev'ed or added.

text:
On Julia 1.4+
use `Pkg.dependencies()` (check its docstring).
if it is `dev`ed then the PackageInfo’s `istracking_path` should return `true`

using can use `Basse.PkgId(Foo).uuid` to get the UUID of the `Foo` module if loaded.
I don’t think there is an easier way to get UUID
(PkgId does `ccall(:jl_module_uuid` under the hood)

elements.text: to get the UUID of the

module if loaded.

text:
> I don’t think there is an easier way to get UUID
Looking in `Base.loaded_modules` is probably better since it will give you what is actually loaded
